title: 5,002 persons vaccinated against COVID-19
body_lines: Epidemiology Unit data shows that COVID-19 vaccines were administered to 5,002 persons on Saturday.
These were mainly booster vaccines, which have been administered to a total of 7,908,378 persons. On Saturday, 3,382 persons received the booster dose.
The first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine has been administered to 17,018,959 persons and the second dose has been administered to 14,436,092 persons.

On Saturday, 372 persons received the first dose of Pfizer and 1,057 persons received the second dose of the vaccine. A total of 2,526,910 persons have received the first dose of Pfizer and 896,910 persons have received the second dose as well.

The first dose of Sinopharm has been administered to 12,048,507 persons. This includes 23 persons vaccinated on Saturday. The second dose of Sinopharm was administered to 168 persons on Saturday and a total of 11,177,416 persons have received the second dose of the vaccine to date. The Epidemiology Unit states that 1,479,631 persons have received the first dose of AstraZeneca and 1,418,593 persons have received the second dose of the vaccine.
The first dose of Moderna has been administered to 804,801 persons and the second dose has been administered to 787,361 persons.
A total of 159,110 persons have received the first dose of Sputnik V and 155,812 persons have received the second dose.
